column4: hi, i downloaded the latest java runtime environment (the bin-file) and i believe i installed it, but "java -version" still returns the old version number
do i have to reboot after installing a new java verison?
no
reboot only if you are booting into a new kernel
then how do i upgrade the java re? i ran the bin-file from the sun website
did you have jre installed previous?
yes, the package that comes with ubuntu
did you uninstall it before installing the other one?
no. sounds reasonable, though :)
yeah that could be very messy now
its not in the same directory
well that's good then, I imagine that there is a file in /etc/profile.d that sets certain java variables, you would need to replace that obviously
alright. how come ubuntu comes with such an old version of java, anyway?
um java 6?
java -version: "1.4.2"
uh oh... i am missing something here...
it wants to remove those because those things probably depend on the package you are trying to remove, if you want those packages to even be usable, you better keep that dependency
bullgard4: it's a lirc library for remote controls. i want to cleanly install lirc from source...
compile it and install it on top of the lirc package
ok thx
you wan't the package management to know you have lirc installed
